events.name: RSA: DevSecOps Group Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone,¬† We will be holding a DevSecOps group Meetup on July 26th at the RSAC conference. RSAC has kindly provided us with a room.¬† This will be a multi-group Meetup with several groups from around Singapore. The meeting will be from 5:30pm to 8:00pm with excellent guest speakers Damon Edwards and John Willis.¬† Also, you can register for the RSAC DevSecOps free of charge. Go to https://www.rsaconference.com/events/ap17 and register for the conference with a Visitor Pass. Then you will receive full access to the DevSecOps sessions on July 25 and to the main Keynotes at RSAC . On behalf of the DevSecOps Singapore Core Team, see you all there!
events.location: Marina Bay Sands, Sands Expo and Convention Center, Cassia Ballroom (Level 3), 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 01

events.name: #01 - Why do we use Sketch?
events.description:
We are kicking off Singapore's Sketch & Design Meetup with tremendous support from ShopBack (www.shopback.sg) who has generously sponsored pizza and drinks for the event! Oh, there's beer too üçïüçª Who should attend? Budding Sketch users and those who are shopping around for another tool. There¬†will have subsequent Meetups with dedicated content for Sketch pros.¬†Nevertheless, Sketch pros are welcome to share and care (though you may already be familiar with the content we will be covering for this session). - In this first Meetup, the organizers will be discussing the following topics: ‚Ä¢¬†Why did Jules want to¬†organize this Meetup? ‚Ä¢¬†What is Sketch and why should you use it? ‚Ä¢¬†The State of the Union for design and rapid prototyping software in mid-2017 ‚Ä¢ Resources for budding Sketch users ‚Ä¢¬†Demo on how user interfaces are created in Sketch ‚Ä¢¬†Sketch plugins you can integrate with your workflows ‚Ä¢ Sharing and Q&A session Bohemian Coding is in the midst of sending over some "Sketch Swag" which will be given out at the Meetup! Don't miss the chance to grab them! - We aim to have this Meetup serve as a platform for dialogues to start between speakers, panelists, and audience; therefore, it will be great if you could take a few minutes to answer a few questions to help shape and propel conversations from here on out -¬†https://sketchdesignsg.typeform.com/to/m1sR6s If in doubt, please reach out to Jules at [masked] 


Thank you so much and we look forward to a fruitful Meetup!
events.location: ShopBack, Block 77 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03-23, Singapore

events.name: Azure In-Memory Computing: Start a 4000 cores, 60TB RAM cluster in 30 mins
events.description:
Level 21 Room: MPR-02 7:15 pmTopic: In-Memory Computing on Microsoft Azure: Start a 4000 cores, 60TB RAM cluster in 30 minutes Synopsis:In-Memory Computing brings the ability to do everything on the fly, analytics and calculations as well, and the ActiveViam In-Memory analytical platform has long been a secret weapon of large organisations to deliver operational analytics on Big Data. But today Microsoft Azure and ActiveViam have partnered to build an in-memory analytics cluster that everyone can use. It takes advantage of scalable cloud storage and powerful servers you can start on demand, so you can get thousands of cores and tens of terabytes of memory up and running in less than 30 minutes. Join us for the full story! We'll share what we learned and give all the steps to do it. Speakers: Speaker1 : Nida Bouzid Nida is currently the Technical Manager of ActiveViam in APAC. Nida and his team work on implementing, supporting and deploying ActiveViam products for financial institutions (banks, exchanges, asset managers, hedge funds‚Ä¶.). In the region for about 7 years, he joined ActiveViam in 2007 and was part of the Paris R&D team.¬† Prior to that, he has served as a Senior Technical Consultant within Misys Treasury and Capital Market in Paris as a consultant on Summit Systems software. Speaker 2: Antoine Chambille Antoine is a tech leader and the creator of the ActiveViam analytical platform, now a global benchmark for real-time analytics in Java. Regular speaker at international tech conferences such as JavaOne, Devoxx or Discover, Antoine's favourite topics are In-Memory Computing, Big Data and Cloud Computing. 


Join Us and win limited number of exciting giveaways like Adafruit Fuzzah Kit, Build Jackets, Windows 10 Pens..
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Talk.CSS #19 CodePen Special Edition
events.description: Join us for a special CodePen edition of Talk.CSS. We have lots of goodies to give away so RVSP now! Latest CSS news by Talk.CSSOur new regular segment which will cover latest updates in the realm of CSS and HTML. Can I please write inline styles? by See Yishu Chinese lyric translation by William Lim The CSS doctor is inLayouts looking a bit broken? CSS issues getting you down? We're here to help. Tell us your CSS problem and get a crowd-sourced solution from all the CSS enthusiasts in Singapore right here. Speakers TBC. Have something you want to share? Let us know! Lightning talks welcome, just poke Chris or Huijing when you get there. We welcome any CSS-related topics at ANY level because we‚Äôre all here to learn and share :)
events.location: Rakuten Viki, 138 Market Street, Lv.32, Singapore

events.name: Meet the fellows!
events.description:
Hej, data folks. First of all, thank you for joining this group. I am really excited to meet you all and I hope you feel the same way. Here is the agenda of our first event: Program outline:¬† ‚Ä¢¬†6.30pm - 7pm: ¬† ¬† ¬†Networking, food and drinks ‚Ä¢¬†7pm - 7.45pm: ¬† ¬† ¬† Vis.sg is a website about Singapore. If you would like to speak on the event click here. If you would like to ask a question(any question), click¬†here. Leave your feedback¬†here. Your help is so much appreciated. =) 


Cheers See you soon!
